name: places/ChIJW2D3c5v2wokRobZ7nQp0Fqk
formattedAddress: 161 Fort Washington Ave #524, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 161 Fort Washington Ave #524, New York, NY 10032, USA

originalText.text:
I had my vertical sleeve gastrectomy with Dr. Bessler on 3/14/2016 and was blown away by the level of care I received from him and his team.  I was 407 lbs at my highest weight and ~365 lbs on the day of surgery.  I reached my lowest weight, 223 lbs, at about 1.5 years post-op.

I had no complications during surgery and have never regretted the choice to be proactive about my health by getting weight loss surgery.  I know it's not the right choice for everyone, but if you think it may be the right choice for you, I cannot recommend Dr. Bessler enough.  You will be in good hands.

originalText.text: Already had 2 surgeries performed by Dr Bessler and I couldn't be happier with the results.

text.text: Already had 2 surgeries performed by Dr Bessler and I couldn't be happier with the results.

originalText.text: I just had surgery and the surgeon and his staff put me at ease before the surgery.  I had a speedy recovery with minimal discomfort. The incisions were small without pain. Dr. Bessler has over 25 years of bariatric experience and it showed.  I feel great and cannot wait to see how this new chapter in my life will play out. The nurses and professionals at the hospital were fabulous. They catered to my needs there. I made the right decision.

originalText.text: Congratulations Dr Bessler on all the great reviews. Savings lives related to obesity. Wow!!!. Now 12/27/17 please save my cousin Violeta. You were the surgeon who performed her surgery. What happened!!!. She sustained gastric perforation. 3 days she remained in pain. Nurses gave lots of pain pills. You were not around. When family complained doctors discovered gastric juice leakage. They gave mo hope. She was incubated. Her wound remains opened. Today she is being dc to a nursing home!! What happened! !! Where are you.

They gave mo hope. She was incubated. Her wound remains opened. Today she is being dc to a nursing home!! What happened! !! Where are you.

originalText.text:
Dr. Bessler saved my life TWICE.  I had a banded gastric bypass in 2004 that went bad.  Bleeding ulcers, band eroding into my pouch, a fistula.  I went from 272 lbs to 98 lbs.  In 2007 He revised the original surgery and gave me back my life.  Unfortunately, I developed another bleeding ulcer that healed but scarred over the anasotmosis and I couldn’t eat, could barely drink for 3-4 months. In 2014 I was hospitalized for weeks at a time on IV TPN.  I was down to 85lbs.  I called Dr.Bessler and he saved my life again by reversing my bypass.  I am  now  about 125 lbs. Dr. Bessler is the best expert bariatric surgeon! I cannot say enough about Dr. and his excellent staff!
Thank you, Dr. Bessler and staff!

In 2007 He revised the original surgery and gave me back my life.  Unfortunately, I developed another bleeding ulcer that healed but scarred over the anasotmosis and I couldn’t eat, could barely drink for 3-4 months. In 2014 I was hospitalized for weeks at a time on IV TPN.  I was down to 85lbs.  I called Dr.Bessler and he saved my life again by reversing my bypass.  I am  now  about 125 lbs.
